meanings.definition: The capacity to develop or become something in the future.
meanings.sent1: Her potentiality for growth was evident in her dedication to learning.
meanings.sent2: The seeds hold the potentiality to grow into beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The potentiality of the caterpillar turning into a butterfly amazed the children.
meanings.sent4: His potentiality to lead the team to victory shone brightly during the game.
meanings.sent5: The potentiality of the acorn to become a mighty oak tree is a marvel of nature.

meanings.definition: The inherent ability or power to achieve or succeed.
meanings.sent1: With hard work and determination, she unlocked her potentiality for success.
meanings.sent2: The potentiality within him to excel in sports was undeniable.
meanings.sent3: The potentiality of the little ant to lift many times its weight amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her potentiality to inspire others was like a beacon of light in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The potentiality of the sunflower to follow the sun's path is a symbol of resilience.

meanings.definition: The possibility of something happening or being true.
meanings.sent1: There is a potentiality of rain later in the day.
meanings.sent2: The potentiality of finding a rare gem in the cave excited the explorers.
meanings.sent3: The potentiality of the cat learning to play the piano brought laughter to the family.
meanings.sent4: The potentiality of love to heal all wounds is a timeless truth.
meanings.sent5: The potentiality of the volcano erupting kept the villagers on edge.
